description:
doc: mention Go 1.1 $GOPATH restriction when using go install

Fixes issue 5396.

messages.text:
Hello r@golang.org, adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/9145045/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9145045/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode362 doc/go1.1.html:362: build and install be within a $GOPATH workspace. worth also mention: also note that "go get" (without -d) implies "go install", so the old idiom of "go get ./..." to get dependencies installed won't work outside of GOPATH.
I'm happy for someone else to take a stab at this. I'm leery of trying to add more words to this section of the document.

I'm also happy to leave it alone.

-rob

SGTM, I will abandon this proposal. 



On 04/05/2013, at 12:43 AM, Rob Pike <r@golang.org> wrote:

> I'm also happy to leave it alone.
> 
> -rob

https://codereview.appspot.com/9145045/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9145045/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode362 doc/go1.1.html:362: build and install be within a $GOPATH workspace. > also note that "go get" (without -d) implies "go install", so the old > idiom of "go get ./..." to get dependencies installed won't work > outside of GOPATH. Someone on IRC was complaining about this yesterday, he thought it was a bug.

On 2013/05/03 16:30:54, aram wrote:
> Someone on IRC was complaining about this yesterday, he thought it was a bug.

Just to add one more note, that someone was me.  I know it isn't a bug that the behavior changed, I just think said change ought to be noted in the migration doc, because I noticed that it wasn't. :)  You guys really do good work, and I trust your reasoning. :)
